notes: historical singular; plural 'soldi' used to mean money
indefinite article for words beginning with s+consonant
definite article for words beginning with s+consonant
plural commonly used as a mass noun meaning 'money'
definite plural for nouns beginning with s+consonant
partitive plural; contraction of di + gli

example_sentence_english: I do not think about money.
It depends on the money you save.

example_sentence_italian: Non credo negli soldi come soluzione.
example_sentence_english: I do not believe in money as a solution.

example_sentence_italian: Ho letto un articolo sugli soldi.
example_sentence_english: I read an article about money.

notes: contraction of con + gli (archaic but attested)
example_sentence_english: We leave with the money we have.
